articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Palestine
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Palestine 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Mahmoud Abbas, president of the State of Palestine, on the occasion of the Day of World Solidarity with the Palestinian people.
					 The message said that Israel's illegal expansion of Jewish settlements and racist crackdown upon Palestinians are a stumbling block lying in the way of achieving fair and lasting peace in the Middle East.  
					
					 It reiterated the DPRK's invariable support and solidarity with the Palestinian people in their just cause of retaking the legitimate national rights including the right to found an independent state with Kuds as its capital city and wished the president greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Albanian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Albanian President
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Bujar Nishani, president of Albania, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished the president and people of Albania greater success in their efforts for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: Pak Yong Sik Meets with President of Vietnam
articles.content:
Pak Yong Sik Meets with President of Vietnam
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, who is heading the DPRK military delegation on an official goodwill visit to Vietnam Friday met and had a talk with its President Truong Tan Sang.
					 Truong Tan Sang said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries established by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung are now steadily growing stronger under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the Vietnamese leadership to attach importance to the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries and steadily boost them, he noted.
					
					 Noting that the Vietnamese party, government and people are pleased with the achievements made by the army and people of the DPRK in their efforts for carrying out the cause of socialist construction, he expressed conviction that victory belongs to the DPRK under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present there were members of the delegation, DPRK ambassador to the country, vice-director of the General Office of the Presidency, vice-chief of the general staff of the Vietnam People's Army and officials concerned.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK Military Delegation and Delegation of Ministry of Defense of Vietnam Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK Military Delegation and Delegation of Ministry of Defense of Vietnam Held
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Talks between the DPRK military delegation and the delegation of the Ministry of Defense of Vietnam took place at the building of the Ministry of Defense of Vietnam on Friday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the military delegation led by Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, the DPRK ambassador to the country and from the Vietnamese side Phung Quang Thanh, minister of Defense of Vietnam, vice-chief of the General Staff of the Vietnam People's Army (VPA) and other high-ranking officers.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting exchange and cooperation between the armies of the two countries and reached a consensus of views on the matters discussed.
					
					 Prior to the talks, a ceremony of welcoming the DPRK military delegation was held.
					
					 On the same day the DPRK military delegation was present on invitation at a reception hosted by Phung Quang Thanh.
					
					 The DPRK military delegation visited various places including a unit of the VPA.

articles.title: Delegation of Supreme Public Prosecutors Office of DPRK Leaves for Vietnam
articles.content:
Delegation of Supreme Public Prosecutors Office of DPRK Leaves for Vietnam
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme Public Prosecutors Office headed by Director Jang Pyong Gyu left here Saturday to visit Vietnam.

articles.title: Construction Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Construction Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Many construction projects have been completed in the DPRK, as part of the efforts to provide the people with better living conditions.
					A baby home and an orphanage with a total floor space of 13,000 square meters took their shapes in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province in less than ten months. They have education and exercise rooms, rooms for intelligence games, treatment wards, indoor and outdoor wading pools, etc.
					
					 The Sinuiju Youth Railway Station in North Phyongan Province has been spruced up as required by the developing reality.
					
					 The construction of a three-storied e-library was completed in Hongwon County in South Hamgyong Province. Its total floor space exceeds 1,000 square meters.
					
					 Meanwhile, over 350 modern dwellings have been built in Ryokpho area, Pyongyang.
					
					 Such achievements achieved in construction encourage all the people of the DPRK in their efforts to significantly greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: KPA Air Force Develops into Invincible One
articles.content:
KPA Air Force Develops into Invincible One
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- With the approach of the 70th anniversary of the air force of the Korean People's Army (KPA), servicepersons and civilians in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea recall with deep emotion the ever-victorious road covered by the Juche-oriented air force.
					 After the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, President Kim Il Sung visited the Sinuiju Aviation Association on November 29, Juche 34 (1945), where he delivered a speech "Let Us Create the Air Force of the New Korea" to indicate detailed ways for building an air force in the country.
					
					 Under his wise guidance, a first regular air corps came into being in Korea in 1947.
					
					 In the period of the Fatherland Liberation War, the KPA air force annihilated the south Korean puppet air force in three days after the outbreak of the war and downed a number of U.S. warplanes, including a "B-29".
					
					 In the 1960s, the KPA air force shot down the U.S. spying plane "EC-121", which intruded deep into the DPRK's airspace, killing some 30 aircrew onboard the plane.
					
					 Numbers of the KPA pilots fought in the Vietnam and Mideast wars, demonstrating the might of the heroic Korean people.
					
					 Some years ago, a plane of the KPA air force drove out the U.S. "RC-135" which flew into the DPRK's airspace, demonstrating its full combat readiness.
					
					 KPA Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un convened the first meeting of airpersons of the KPA and organized two rounds of combat flight contests among air commanding officers of the Air and Anti-Air Force of the KPA in an aim to develop the air force into an invincible one.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Making Uninterrupted Innovations and Advances
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Making Uninterrupted Innovations and Advances
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- It is the glorious work style and fighting spirit of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to make uninterrupted innovations and advances to attain higher goals, holding aloft the banner of the three-revolutions, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an editorial.
					 The spirit of a-match-for-a-hundred soldiers and their spirit of conquering any impregnable fortress at one go serve as a powerful driving force for making uninterrupted innovations and advances in the all-out onward movement, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean People's Army is the one of the leader and party which regards great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as its lifeline and holds aloft the red flag of the Workers' Party of Korea as its first colors.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and their followers are now working hard to hold in check the DPRK's advance but the Korean revolution is making rapid progress in keeping with the speed of the march of the People's Army.
					
					 The spirit created by the young shock brigade in the era of Songun in the worksite in Mt. Paektu serves as a powerful engine for making uninterrupted innovations and advances in today's all-out onward movement. 
					
					 The Korean youth are now performing heroic feats in every worksite for building a thriving nation upholding the slogan reflecting the party's trust, the motto of struggle "Let us dash forward along the course of the Korean revolution in the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu!"
					
					 The leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, a great man endowed with the spirit of attack and rare statesman, serves as life-giving water as he trains the army and people of the DPRK as heroes of the era and great masters of creation and main source which makes the country advance at an unimaginable rare speed.
					
					 The editorial calls for greeting the 7th Congress of the WPK as a great heyday of the revolution to be specially recorded in the history of the party by giving fuller play to the heroic mettle of Songun Korea in the on-going advance through uninterrupted innovations and advances.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps South Korean Authorities' Confrontation Racket
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps South Korean Authorities' Confrontation Racket 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, a "memorial service" was held in Seoul to commemorate the 5th anniversary of Yonphyong Island shelling incident. It was attended by the "prime minister", minister of Defence, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, chiefs of staff of ground, naval and air forces of south Korea, the commander of the South Korea-U.S. Combined Forces Command, etc.
					 The south Korean chief executive sent a "video message" to this burlesque in which she cried out for a "rapid reaction to the provocation from the north and establishment of perfect military posture".
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says:
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling incident was a just striking action of the DPRK's army which never pardons those infringing upon its dignity and sovereignty and an admirable retaliatory battle which taught the reckless warmongers what a dear price they had to pay for their provocation.
					
					 The south Korean authorities kicked up confrontation hysteria, again ridiculously describing the Yonphyong Island shelling incident as "provocation from the north." This was nothing but a foolish charade aimed to cover up their true colors as reckless provocateurs against the DPRK and retrieve their disgraceful bitter defeat at any cost.
					
					 What merits attention is that the confrontation racket was timed to coincide with the working-level contact for talks between authorities of the north and the south. This burlesque was a challenge to the sincere efforts of the DPRK for the inter-Korean dialogue and the improvement of the relations as it was evidently a reckless provocation to chill the climate for mending the relations.
					
					 It is by no means accidental that the south Korean authorities staged such charade rattling the nerves of the dialogue partner under the pretext of observing the above-said anniversary just before the inter-Korean dialogue. This fully revealed their inveterate hostility and intention to escalate the confrontation with the compatriots in the north.
					
					 They would be well advised to cool their heads heated with confrontation hysteria, come to their senses and refrain from making remarks getting on the nerves of their dialogue partner and creating a catastrophic situation.

articles.title: S. Korean Peasants' Organizations Denounce Chief Executive's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
S. Korean Peasants' Organizations Denounce Chief Executive's Reckless Remarks 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- South Korean peasants' organizations including the Federation of Peasants Associations, Federation of Women Peasants Associations and Catholic Peasants Association held a press conference in Jongro District, Seoul on November 25 to denounce the reckless remarks let loose by the chief executive. 
					 Kim Yong Ho, chairman of the Federation of Peasants Associations, said the participants in the all-out people's action branded as "group of terrorists" by the chief executive were peasants who have farmed for several decades suffering heavy losses, part-time workers and citizens opposed to the "state-compiled" history textbook. 
					
					 Pak Sok Un, co-representative of the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea, said the "president's" reckless labeling of protesters as "group of terrorists" was insult to the people and nonsense. 
					
					 A press release was read out there. 
					
					 It said that the "government" branded the all-out people's action as a "violent demo" before its start and was busy with spreading false stories and set up barricades to block the peaceful march, firing water cannons at them. 
					
					 What matters is the "president" knows nothing about human ethnics and impartiality, the press release deplored, urging her to properly know she is not a ruler reigning over the people.

articles.title: KCTU Declares 2nd All-out People's Action, General Strike
articles.content:
KCTU Declares 2nd All-out People's Action, General Strike 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a meeting in Youido, Seoul on November 24 to denounce the authorities' retrogressive revision of labor law and oppressive rule. 
					 Speakers criticized the authorities' dictatorial acts of wantonly abusing the people's right to existence and human rights by brutally suppressing the participants in rallies and demos and unilaterally carrying out the retrogressive revision of labor law. 
					
					 Choe Jong Jin, chief vice-chairman of the KCTU, accused the "Saenuri Party" of going to unilaterally railroad the bill on retrogressive revision of labor law through the "National Assembly". He called for staging the second all-out people's action and general strike of workers on December 5 to prevent the retrogressive revision of labor law and force the present "government" to step down. 
					
					 Prior to this, the KCTU held a press conference outside the "National Assembly". 
					
					 Noting that the main target of the second all-out people's action and the general strike would be politicians who sold out their conscience for the retrogressive revision of labor law, the organization would surely punish those who took part in the retrogressive revision of the law.

articles.title: Religionists of S. Korea Accuse Lawmaker from "Saenuri Party" of Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Religionists of S. Korea Accuse Lawmaker from "Saenuri Party" of Reckless Remarks 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Religionists under the Pastors' Council for Realizing Justice and Peace, the Catholic Priests' Council for Justice and the Round Buddhist Association for Teaching Social Changes of south Korea held a press conference at Jogye Temple in Seoul on November 25 at which they denounced the outbursts let loose by Kim Jin Thae, lawmaker from the "Saenuri Party", according to the south Korean CBS. 
					 They lashed out at Kim Jin Thae for crying out for arresting Han Sang Gyun, chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, even by hurling policemen to Jogye Temple. 
					
					 While being on the want list of the authorities, Han attended a rally held as part of the all-out people's action on November 14 at which he bitterly condemned the regime's retrogressive revision of the labor law and has taken refuge at the temple since then. 
					
					 The above-said lawmaker let loose such outbursts against this backdrop. 
					
					 Infuriated by this, religionists demanded the resignation of Kim Jin Thae and formal apology from the "Saenuri Party."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Koreans in China 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A committee of the General Association of Koreans in China for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Shenyang on Nov. 25.
					 Choe Un Bok, chairwoman of the association, was elected chairwoman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse events such as laying floral baskets, meeting, remembrance event and film show on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It also decided to hold a meeting for adopting a letter of loyalty to supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Hungarian Political Party on Its Homepage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Hungarian Political Party on Its Homepage
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" was posted by the Hungarian Workers' Party on its website on Nov. 20.
					 The work published on April 18, Juche 87 (1998) clarifies the 5-Point Policy of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation which serves as important guidelines for achieving the great unity of the whole nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Austrian Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Austrian Organization on Its Website
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was posted by the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK on its website on Nov. 23.
					 The work published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012) clarifies that it is the principled requirement for victoriously advancing the cause of the Korean revolution to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and indicates the tasks for steadily developing the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Thailand
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Thailand
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A Thai committee for remembering H.E. Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 12.
					 Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including remembrance meeting, seminar, lecture and film show on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Serbia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Serbia
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The committee of the New Yugoslav Communist Party for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Serbia on Nov. 19.
					 Marijan Kubik, international secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize significant political and cultural events praising the sacred revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il and his undying feats in the capital and local areas from Nov. 19 to Dec. 24.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Romania
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Romania
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A Romanian national committee for remembering General Secretary Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 12.
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Socialist Party of Romania, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the undying feats of leader Kim Jong Il and hold political and cultural events such as remembrance meeting, seminar and lecture from Nov. 20 to Dec. 17.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A seminar took place in Bangladesh and a reading session on the work of leader Kim Jong Il in DR Congo and lectures in Hungary and Slovenia from Nov. 17 to 22 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					 Displayed at the venue of the seminar were photos dealing with the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Speakers including the chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers’ Party of Bangladesh who doubles as minister of Civil Aviation and Tourism and the chairman of the Bangladesh People's League said that Kim Jong Il was the great statesman who developed the DPRK, adding that thanks to his wise leadership the Korean people could firmly protect the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation from the imperialists' vicious moves to stifle the DPRK and it could proudly emerge a political, ideological and military power.
					
					 The chairperson of the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in DR Congo said at the reading session on Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" that the epoch-making changes in the DPRK would be unthinkable without Kim Jong Il's immortal exploits.
					
					 Lectures sponsored by the Hungarian Workers' Party and the Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association said that the Workers' Party of Korea is translating the people's all dreams and ideals into reality under the uplifted banner of the people-first principle and will demonstrate only victories and glories in the future, too, just as it brought about epoch-making changes by leading the people in the past.

articles.title: Pak Yong Sik se reune con Truong Tan Sang
articles.content:
Pak Yong Sik se reune con Truong Tan Sang
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres Pak Yong Sik, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares quien preside la delegacion militar de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica Socialista de Vietnam, se departio el dia 27 en la presidencia con el presidente de la Republica Socialista de Vietnam, Truong Tan Sang.
					  En la ocasion el presidente vietnamita se refirio a que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Vietnam y Corea preparadas por el Presidente Ho Chi Minh y el Presidente Kim Il Sung se consolidan y se desarrollan incesantemente bajo profunda atencion de los dirigentes de los dos paises.
					
					  Dijo que es invariable la posicion de la direccion de Vietnam de dar importancia a las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y de ampliarlas y desarrollarlas continuamente.
					
					  Prosiguio que el Partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de Vietnam se alegran de los exitos que el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC logran en el cumplimiento de la causa de construccion socialista y subrayo que convence el triunfo de la RPDC que goza de la sabia direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los miembros de la delegacion, el embajador coreano en este pais asiatico, el subdirector de la Oficina General de la Presidencia, el subjefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Vietnam y otros funcionarios vietnamitas.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de RPDC y Vietnam
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de RPDC y Vietnam
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 27 en la sede del Ministerio de Defensa de Vietnam las conversaciones entre la delegacion militar de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la del Ministerio de Defensa de la Republica Socialista de Vietnam.
					Participaron, por la parte coreana, los miembros de la delegacion militar encabezada por el general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres, Pak Yong Sik, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares y el embajador coreano en Vietnam, y por la vietnamita, el ministro de Defensa Phung Quang Thanh, el subjefe del Estado Mayor General y otros funcionarios del circulo militar.
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones de ampliar y desarrollar el intercambio y cooperacion entre los ejercitos de los dos paises y llegaron a la identidad del criterio en los problemas discutidos.
					
					Con anterioridad al dialogo, tuvo lugar una ceremonia de bienvenida a la delegacion militar coreana.
					
					El mismo dia, la delegacion militar coreana fue invitada al banquete ofrecido por el ministro de Defensa vietnamita.
					
					Por otra parte, la delegacion coreana visito una unidad del Ejercito Popular de Vietnam y otros lugares.
